page.title: 03 WOKINGHAM ECOLOGY STUDY
page.content: On a walk by the{Emmbrook}stream we found many plants.There were lots of stinging nettles and comfrey.A two spot ladybird was sitting on hogweed. Goosegrass was clinging to other plants because its own stem couldn't support it.(This is also called Sticky Billy).The ground elder was like a spring green carpet.Meadow buttercups were growing in little clusters.Here are some of the other plants and trees we saw_white dead nettle,white clover, cow parsley, Himalayan Balsam,cut leaved cranesbill,mugwort,pineapple week,oak,sallow,hawthorn,crack willow, alder,osier and weeping willow. {In August 1984 the Emmbrook was {polluted by a leakage of chemicals {from a nearby factory.Thousands of {fish were killed.The company who {caused this was fined Â£2,000 and {helped to restock the Emm with fish. }
